name: Hot Dip
author: Natalie Smiles
summary: This delicious dip is always best when it's served really warm -- works well with breadsticks and assorted crackers.  I make it during the holidays when JOY is in the air and romance is always in style.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, cut into cubes
directions: Place bacon slices in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Remove bacon, crumble and set aside
Drain off all but 2 tablespoons of the bacon drippings
Add mushrooms, onion and garlic to the bacon drippings, and cook over medium heat, stirring, until tender and most of the liquid has evaporated
Sprinkle the flour, salt, and pepper over the top, and stir to blend
Mix in cream cheese, Worcestershire sauce, and soy sauce
Reduce heat to low, and stir until cream cheese is melted
Stir in the sour cream and bacon
